content.p: Home isn’t a place – it’s the feeling that you’re free to be whoever you want to be. And you’ve just found it. Wherever you’re coming to us from, we want your first few days, weeks and months at the University of Nottingham to be as brilliant as possible. We're here to support you every step of the way. Here’s everything you need to know as a new student, from getting your results through to arrival and settling into life on campus. It’s normal if you feel a bit nervous, so make sure to also check out our student vlogs on what to expect when starting your journey at Nottingham. Tasks you need to complete before you begin Everything you need to know when you arrive Explore the Welcome week programme of events Prepare for your course with relevant information. Resources to support your wellbeing How to get here and ways to get around Download the official app to access to welcome information, your timetable, email, library account, maps and more. UON Nottingham’s Student Union is home to more than 300 societies and over 70 sports clubs, there’s something for everyone. Hear about NatSci Soc Division of Physiotherapy or Sport Rehabilitation Get hands-on sports injury experience at the David Ross Sports Village. Civil Engineering Follow Feroz, as he attends his group design project seminar, meets with his tutor and attends a fundamental materials lecture. If you’re looking for more information, please head to our help and support hub, where you can find frequently asked questions or details of how to make an enquiry.
